adjective.description: (of a person or their body) strongly and solidly built.
examples: he had a sturdy, muscular physique

noun.description: Vertigo in sheep caused by a tapeworm larva encysted in the brain.

origin: Middle English (in the senses reckless, violent and intractable, obstinate): shortening of Old French esturdi stunned, dazed. The derivation remains obscure; thought by some to be based on Latin turdus a thrush (compare with the French phrase soûl comme une grive drunk as a thrush).
